definition: to remonstrate/to warn earnestly (esp. classical written Chinese)/to exhort

sentences.english: We tried remonstrating with him over his treatment of the children.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾試着在對待孩子上規諫他。

sentences.english: The old man remonstrated about his foolish behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 老人對他的愚行提出規諫。

sentences.english: In ancient times, loyal officials were always punished after directly speaking out against the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 古代，忠臣往往因爲直言規諫君王而遭受處罰。
